text: What's the most pythonic way to ensure that all elements of a list are different?
I have a list in Python that I generate as part of the program.
I have a strong assumption that these are all different, and I check this with an assertion.
This is the way I do it now:

code:
try:
    assert(x[0] != x[1])
except:
    print debug_info
    raise Exception("throw to caller")

try:
    assert(x[0] != x[1])
    assert(x[0] != x[2])
    assert(x[1] != x[2])
except:
    print debug_info
    raise Exception("throw to caller")

text: And if I ever have to do this with four elements I'll go crazy.
Is there a better way to ensure that all the elements of the list are unique?
